author: Staff Reporter
text:
To cater to the power needs of the petrol bunk, a solar energy producing facility was inaugurated at a dealer outlet of the Indian Oil Corporation Limited (IOCL) in Rasipuram here recently.

The 3 kW solar power units can be used to operate the two pumps, lights, fans in the outlet and can save up to 12 units of power everyday for the outlet.

T. Palanikumar, chief divisional retail sales manager, Salem Division, inaugurated the facility.

Rahul Bharadwaj, sales officer, Namakkal district of IOCL, members of Rasipuram Lorry Owners Association, and dealers wre present.

Mr. Palanikumar said that the facility would help cut carbon emission and also save natural resources. The system was installed by Green Energy Foundation, a vendor of IOCL.
title: Solar power for fuel station
